intro: Thamnochortus occultus, commonly known as the hidden chortus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. Thamnochortus occultus is well adapted to arid environments, with succulent leaves that store water. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
